title: Hijacked account resulting in permanent ban HELP!
body:
Hello my fellow summoners,
So this is quite distressing because my account that i've had since season 3 essentially got hacked and got me permanently banned.
By no means am I saying that i'm perfect, all the previous infringements on my account were incurred by me and i realise that my behavior was unacceptable and by that point i had actually reformed (which i can actually provide semi proof about too).
I was on my last chance obviously and its been unfairly taken away from me by this account hijacker.
I have sent tickets to riot support (approximately 4), but they keep giving me copy and pasted generic responses,** so i would really love to talk to someone (rioter or official) who has compassion and a heart and is willing to actually listen to what I've got to say and it into account. ** i'm sick of the generic copy and pasted messages they give me.

I actually have** some sort of proof** that I wasn't actually on the account (has to do with my ISP and IP not just my word). I had even changed my password several times in a short period of time because i had suspicions my account was being hijacked, but again riot support refuses to listen to me. 
I had actually been away for roughly a one month period when i came back to my permanent ban (uni exam time).

Feel free to add me in client - "mayo jnr"     if you would like to discuss anything in regards to my ban (particularly rioters). Or if you can get me in contact with someone who can help me i would appreciate it so much! Maybe i will gift u xx
{{sticker:cass-cry}} 
Feel free to leave your opinion below
Thank you my friends, I hope we can free mayo.

replies.body:
Hi Mayo,

I'm afraid we can't unban this account.

While it may be that you were not the one playing on the account at the time the permanent ban took place, I believe responsibility does sit with you as the account owner in this instance.

Your last password reset was 6 months prior to the ban. During this period of time, your account was accessed many times by someone you knew. Given the time frames of the login records, I have no doubt you would have seen the "Your account has been logged into from another computer" message in client at least once in those 6 months. This should have been a clear trigger for you to perform another password reset to secure your account.

Your account being in such severe negative standing prior to the permanent ban was due to your own actions in game, as you mentioned.

I'm sorry to say it, but because your account's permanent ban was ultimately your responsibility, the ban should not be removed.

> I have no doubt you would have seen the "Your account has been logged into from another computer" message in client at least once in those 6 months.

Wait.... if that is a thing to pop up, why hadn't i seen this when i got a new computer?

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-02-01T06:44:11.346+0000)
>
> Wait.... if that is a thing to pop up, why hadn't i seen this when i got a new computer?

Were you at the same place though?

If i recall correctly no, but Seras already said that it's to do with being forced logged out because someone else logged in (how that justifies this topic is beyond me but whatever not much we can do)
Yeah it's just for being force logged out. I gather this guys case was a lot more complicated than it looked. Only Gehirn would really know though.
EDIT: It only shows when you get logged out by logging in elsewhere.
WHAT A JOKE

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-02-01T06:44:11.346+0000)
>
> Wait.... if that is a thing to pop up, why hadn't i seen this when i got a new computer?

I also used a different computer and never saw this. i am very confident i never saw the message, but i don't really pay much attention to pop ups!

EDIT: i just realized, on my new account i had played on my computer and then over the weekend i went to my parents house which is quite a distance away from me and i played on my dads computer and i never got the message, so now i'm very confident that the message never showed.
EDIT: The popup occurs when you get logged out by someone else logging in elsewhere.

Hi Gehirn,
Thank you for your response!
I understand everything that you have said, and it makes total sense. I had suspected it was somebody i knew, and i have actually said that in the support tickets i sent to riot support!

However, 
As you have access to the login records you can see i don't believe I logged in many times during that 6 month period. I had just moved away from home and started university. i was really busy and i didn't really have my computer to play games on. I do not recall seeing that message at all but im sure you can check if i got that message. 

Also, before that month, you can see i was changing my password very frequently due to the suspicion i had. i was just very busy in that 6 month period and didnt play league much then or enough to notice. if i did play it was one or two games. 

I know before the ban took place it was a full 26 days before i had logged on.
I appreciate the fact that you know someone else was on my account, because the language and things they would say are very different to what i would do. The person on my account was a different kind of toxic to me. this is at-least some closure. 

I am willing to provide any other information or documentation from my end Gehirn that you may require.

I would really appreciate it if you could add me in game for a conversation.

Thank you again for your response and i hope we can work this out!

Hi Mayo, I have since performed an extremely thorough investigation and still conclude that the account should not be unbanned. As the details of this investigation are more sensitive I have included them in a reply to your latest ticket.
Obviously this person you knew kept getting access to your new password, so my question is how? If you were giving someone your password, then that's on you.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-02-01T07:50:44.720+0000)
>
> Obviously this person you knew kept getting access to your new password, so my question is how? If you were giving someone your password, then that's on you.

You make a fair point and of course i know it sounds dodgy. I had a virus filled computer so potentially that is the reason, maybe keylogged?
If i was giving someone my password i think it would defeat the purpose if i kept changing it. Obviously if you give someone the password to play on the account you wouldn't keep changing it?

As for the login message, i still have no recollection of it and im confident that i did not see a message like that, otherwise of course i would have changed my password! like i said i played very few games and i was only on a night time. 
I was very conscious of my account as i think i've spent around $500 on that account. i think i put my birthday and christmas money into the account over a 3-4 year period.
its been banned for about half a year. my story doesn't sound believable but im being honest and i don't want to simply give up the account because of someone else on my account. I'm really hoping my side of the story is helping gehirn put the pieces together of what he's seeing in his side and taking into account what im saying.

I'm sure i could accept it if it was me being toxic for that final stroke. 

Thanks for the response

If you knew you had viruses why not remove them? There is plenty of free and effective software available to do so.

Essentially it comes down to the burden of security being on you. If you were compromised from elsewhere or through Riot then that would be different, but given it was someone you knew who you either gave the password to repeatedly, or more than likely had physical access to your computer, these are things that you cannot reasonably expect Riot to protect you from.

Players and popups tend not to mix. As silly as it seems to me that people would just blindly hit ok on something without reading it, there is proof of it happening all the time. The dozens of posts we get about placements are testament to that. I wouldn't be surprised at all if you simply clicked without noticing what the popup actually was.

You can see how much money you've spent on the account here: http://privacy.riotgames.com/en_US/ Though it doesn't always work the best. That said, how much money you've spent doesn't change anything. All players are treated the same, regardless of if they spend money or not.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-01T10:49:53.483+0000)
>
> If you knew you had viruses why not remove them? There is plenty of free and effective software available to do so.
> 
> Essentially it comes down to the burden of security being on you. If you were compromised from elsewhere or through Riot then that would be different, but given it was someone you knew who you either gave the password to repeatedly, or more than likely had physical access to your computer, these are things that you cannot reasonably expect Riot to protect you from.
> 
> Players and popups tend not to mix. As silly as it seems to me that people would just blindly hit ok on something without reading it, there is proof of it happening all the time. The dozens of posts we get about placements are testament to that. I wouldn't be surprised at all if you simply clicked without noticing what the popup actually was.
> 
> You can see how much money you've spent on the account here: http://privacy.riotgames.com/en_US/ Though it doesn't always work the best. That said, how much money you've spent doesn't change anything. All players are treated the same, regardless of if they spend money or not.

You made some very valid points there. 
I'll try to address your points in the most progressive and logical way i possibly can.

**Viruses:**
yes, i had a virussy computer but it wasn't at the point where it wasn't unreliable or horrible, it ran fine but i was aware it had some viruses. i wasn't really in a state to spend the money on antivirus anyway. Like you said, regardless of money everyone should be treated fairly, so because i wasnt able to buy antivirus and my account was compromised because of it i don't deserve my account back? 

**Security:**
Yes you are also correct that security is up to me. and i tried to maintain it as best as i could. Like ive explained, as soon as i was aware of a lack of integrity on my account i changed my password.
Firstly, this person who i suspect it is - and im still not sure it was them has no access to my computer physically because if it is who i think it is they're from Sydney or Melbourne and i live in adelaide, so its only via virus, which i just explained the situation about. (now that i think about it, i believe it may have been a link from skype?). At the time i wasn't aware he was the one hacking me, i am only assuming and using hindsight. i'm sure if someone who is ur friend sends u a link on skype you'd click it. 
I am not expecting riot to protect me from viruses, i just am asking riot to please give my account back that i care about highly. You are assuming that i am GIVING my password constantly which i feel is a very unfair thing to do after me having explained my situation.

You are correct, it does not matter how much money i spend on this game, i am expected to behave the same as everyone else and i am in full agreement with you on that one. 
I'm only saying that its hard for me to let go on these terms because it was not me who caused my final chance on my account to be taken away. i just want to prove my innocence and get back to playing on my main account for multiple reasons - not just money. 

This whole time i am fully accepting of all of my previous punishments and anything else you guys say.
i am a person who believes in consequences when i make a mistake. i am honest and i own up to my mistakes. but this i can't justify it being completely my fault. If i was the toxic player who flamed people out and was on the account when it got permanently banned i can live with the punishment.
i was in a period in my life where i was taking a huge step leaving home (a small country town) to move to the city to follow my passion and study health and medical science at university. i was extremely busy trying to learn things like transport (I've never even seen public transport before) or food (i had to learn how to cook because i lived by myself) or even where the university is. it was a huge move for me coming from a small country town with a very tiny population.  not to mention the course that i was studying as well as part time job with my parents to fund all of this. 

I just had a lot going on and i was not able to check league of legends enough to find something fishy. Everyone makes mistakes and i guess mine was not checking up on my account enough (if im being critical of myself). Generally you just assume your account is safe - i mean who regularly checks up on their account to see if its safe. but i'm sure you guys can understand this mistake due to everything that was going on.
I admit people have worse things going on in their life and this isn't really a big deal compared to what other people go through but im sure this is a suffice reason for my inactivity on my account and hence lack of security. 

I know this is just my word but please trust me. I guess i can show documentation of when i started university and where i started living and where i moved from and at what dates - and i will if i have to. **_i feel this is extreme but it is the lengths im willing to go to. _**
_**If I was a liar I wouldn't be able to provide this documentation which I am willing to provide. if I was a liar I would not be this committed to try get my account back**_. I had many contact hours at university and I had work which just ultimately meant I was too busy and thats the truth. 

Again - if there is anything i provide you guys to help this case please ask. 
Thank you again.

Malwarebytes will do almost everything you need as far as viruses are concerned, and it's free. You don't need to buy antivirus to keep your computer virus free. 

If you thought your account was still compromised through multiple password changes did you not think it would be worth working out how they were getting the password again and again?

Regardless of the source, if changing your password wasn't enough to secure your account then why take no further steps to secure it?

If you continued to see signs of compromise you should have taken it further (securing your email and computer), not just left it because maybe this time the password change was enough?

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=000200000000000000010000,timestamp=2018-02-01T15:22:44.079+0000)
>
> Malwarebytes will do almost everything you need as far as viruses are concerned, and it's free. You don't need to buy antivirus to keep your computer virus free. 
> 
> If you thought your account was still compromised through multiple password changes did you not think it would be worth working out how they were getting the password again and again?
> 
> Regardless of the source, if changing your password wasn't enough to secure your account then why take no further steps to secure it?
> 
> If you continued to see signs of compromise you should have taken it further (securing your email and computer), not just left it because maybe this time the password change was enough?

Firstly, I have not a single clue what a malware byte is - I'm obviously nowhere near as tech savvy as you my friend. you obviously know your stuff when it comes to computers, I don't have the knowledge that you do and that has played a part in my downfall. 
my email was definitely not compromised I am sure of this. if they had my email they could've changed my password but it was me who was doing the changing. as u said - this time the password change is enough; well the other person on my account had no other infringements up until the permanent ban anyway.
like I just explained, I didn't know how to secure my computer. I knew barely anything about computers - as seen from above I still don't really. being in a remote country town, u can't just pop down to ur local computer shop because we don't have one, and with that we have a severe lack of knowledge. 
I did not have access to the resources you may have where you live. 
I'm sure you will find a response saying that I should just look online but again I didn't know much. I didn't know until recently that key loggers are a thing and people can remotely access ur information. as a matter of fact I don't even know now how a key logger works all I know is that they can get ur details. 

I am talking about a compromised account Seras Dragon - I am sorry that it did happen my friend but the account was compromised. I now know how to prevent this in the future but if I had the knowledge I have now and reading everything you've said I would have avoided this situation. but unfortunately I am in the situation and I am really hoping a riot employee who can understand my situation will be able to help me.  


Looking forward to your response, good to see what people think.

Malwarebytes is just a free antivirus. You can just google "best free antivirus" and you'll get plenty of options regarding that.

As for your account, the only context I have is what Gehirn has given. The fact that he says "someone you knew" is pretty damning, because it's precisely those situations where the burden of security falls on you.

Gehirn (and support) clearly believe you were given plenty of warning and opportunities to secure your account (which to me means there were a lot). If you want to appeal it again, support is the place to do it, but I doubt you'll have much luck.

The free version is free. You don't have to pay for Malwarebytes and the free version does plenty if you aren't clicking on every random ad link you see. The biggest advantage of premium is real time protection which is frankly unnecessary. Just run a scan every other day/week depending on how virus prone you are.
Just downloaded it, yes it's apparently free now, i don't know when they did that, but when i used it like 4 years ago, it wasn't free at that time, just the usual 30 day free trial BS.

I've used it for years (2011~) and it's always been free. They do prompt you to do the 30 day premium trial when you download the free version, but you can either not do it or do it and continue with the free version after.

I mean i know it's one that i've known of as far back as high school, but i may have always mistaken that 30 day trial of the premium as the only thing it had, honestly, i can barely remember things from a year ago, so i could just have forgot.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=000200000000000000010000000000000001000000000001,timestamp=2018-02-02T03:39:49.924+0000)
>
> I've used it for years (2011~) and it's always been free. They do prompt you to do the 30 day premium trial when you download the free version, but you can either not do it or do it and continue with the free version after.

Dear Seras Dragon
i really feel the antivirus thing is becoming a major tangent, i can understand the relevance but i believe it becoming further astray from the point of my boards post.
If there is anything else you would like to speculate about my ban i'm more than willing to answer anything you may have.
thank you again for your ongoing responses

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=00020000000000000001000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-02-02T03:18:08.501+0000)
>
> Just downloaded it, yes it's apparently free now, i don't know when they did that, but when i used it like 4 years ago, it wasn't free at that time, just the usual 30 day free trial BS.

Thanks for the confirmation Wazza, i wish i had used this program earlier!

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=0002000000000000000100000000000000010000,timestamp=2018-02-02T03:12:04.493+0000)
>
> The free version is free. You don't have to pay for Malwarebytes and the free version does plenty if you aren't clicking on every random ad link you see. The biggest advantage of premium is real time protection which is frankly unnecessary. Just run a scan every other day/week depending on how virus prone you are.

Seras dragon i appreciate the information about the antivirus but it is past that point. my promise to you is that i definitely have a protected computer now and i definitely am not toxic now. Again if you dont wish to take my word on it look at my new account - mayo jnr.
This account is extremely clean compared to mayo and i have actually used the reporting system to issue 3 punishments to toxic summoners already. i have definitely learned my lesson about toxicity and i had before my permanent ban was issued by someone else on my account. 

I have spoken to you before Gehirn on league client several years ago (S3/4 - we had a good laugh together - im sure you probably dont remember but i only remember because i was shocked to see how playful rioters can be) and im 100% sure you're a human and not a robot giving general responses and im sure he will take into the account my side of the story if it logically fits what he see's on his side. I have seen examples of this as well with your interactions with my friends

The reality is not all the information can be gained from a computer screen. We are human, the computer can't provide you all the information about how i was living my life and reality. again proof can be provided by documentation that i'm willing to gather for this case.

Thanks again Seras dragon,
if you have anything else you would like to ask me dont hesitate im sure i can explain it to you

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=00020000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-02T01:22:34.338+0000)
>
> Malwarebytes is just a free antivirus. You can just google "best free antivirus" and you'll get plenty of options regarding that.
> 
> As for your account, the only context I have is what Gehirn has given. The fact that he says "someone you knew" is pretty damning, because it's precisely those situations where the burden of security falls on you.
> 
> Gehirn (and support) clearly believe you were given plenty of warning and opportunities to secure your account (which to me means there were a lot). If you want to appeal it again, support is the place to do it, but I doubt you'll have much luck.

Someone i know can mean anyone of your league of legends friends list.
Like i explained before, a friend from ur league friends list sends u a link on skype and u click it. my fault yes, but still that is a person that i know doing the hijacking. its not consensual which is what this case is about. its a hijack. 
Like i explained, i didnt see the warnings as i wasn't on the account very much. As you say, you get the message when someone else logs on right? i played at ridiculous hours where the other person probably wasnt loggin on.

I had multiple opportunities to secure my account; on which occasions i did when i was constantly changing my password. every possibly opportunity that i was aware of, i took it. it was on this occasion that i wasn't aware and it was a costly occasion.

Thanks again

>If you knew you had viruses why not remove them? There is plenty of free and effective software available to do so.

I mean.... a lot of the free software out there (norton in particular) are basically viruses in their own right.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AMqAiGRd,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-01T11:06:10.347+0000)
>
> I mean.... a lot of the free software out there (norton in particular) are basically viruses in their own right.

This is another reason why i did not have any of these programs. i actually only knew of norton and AVG and my dad had norton, and he always complained about his computer so i never got that. i actually think i had AVG installed but obviously that didn't really do anything.
Ps. i dont have that computer any more anyway. i upgraded with Kaspersky antivirus that i managed to buy for $15.

BUMP!
I would really like to hear people's opinion on this!

Thank you riot Gehirn for handling this situation so professionally. 
I appreciate the time and effort you went through for this investigation. 
Its great to see such hard work into smaller players like myself.

Thanks once again

Sorry i know i've posted a lot on this forum and i write so much but i just want to make sure my side is completely understood.
I was talking to someone about the login message that gehirn spoke of. i claim to have never seen this message.

Well i think i know why. 

So when i was busy in that 6 month peroid gehirn spoke of i would hop onto league and jump straight into a game. i wouldn't really sit around afk on the league client. 
so i most of my time playing league of legends and not in the client. 
when i launch league of legends after champ select my league client disappears anyway.
after gaining more information on the matter - the "someone logged into ur account" shows up on that league client that for me always disappeared anyway. (i believe the client disappearing is a normal thing to occur before this new updated client or maybe even for this one im not sure). and the client never opened up again. 
so essentially i never actually got to see the message because my client was disappeared and i just assumed it was a bugsplat. 

Thank you again Gehirn and Seras Dragon
I really hope this is the missing piece of the puzzle.
